simulated_ratings.title: 13th Warrior, The (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Enjoyed the cross-cultural camaraderie and atmosphere, but the action felt pulpy more than profound.

simulated_ratings.title: RRR (2022)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sweeping friendship and rebellion worked for me, though the heightened action theatrics kept me a step back.

simulated_ratings.title: McFarland, USA (2015)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Inspiring and earnest, if familiar in its underdog beats.

simulated_ratings.title: Gettysburg (1993)
simulated_ratings.feeling: The scope and historical focus drew me in despite its length.

simulated_ratings.title: Willow (1988)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Charming adventure, but the fantasy never hit the emotional heights I crave.

simulated_ratings.title: Mr. Holland's Opus (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A heartfelt life’s-work story that resonated with my soft spot for music and mentorship.

simulated_ratings.title: Dangerous Beauty (1998)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sumptuous period romance with a smart, defiant heroine—right up my alley.

simulated_ratings.title: Alone in the Wilderness (2004)
simulated_ratings.feeling: The quiet craftsmanship and self-reliance were deeply satisfying to watch.

simulated_ratings.title: Drop Dead Gorgeous (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: The biting satire lands often enough, even if its broadness wears thin.

simulated_ratings.title: Seabiscuit (2003)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Classic, well-mounted uplift grounded in history—comforting and stirring.

simulated_ratings.title: What Dreams May Come (1998)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Lush, romantic metaphysics that I found moving despite occasional excess.

simulated_ratings.title: Stargate (1994)
simulated_ratings.feeling: The ancient-myth angle intrigued me, though the sci-fi beats felt routine.

simulated_ratings.title: Pride (2014)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Warm, funny, and humane solidarity tale that won me over.

simulated_ratings.title: Sharpe's Rifles (1993)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Gritty Napoleonic adventure with appealing military detail, limited a bit by its TV scope.

simulated_ratings.title: Last Unicorn, The (1982)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Melancholic, lyrical fantasy that charmed me more than most kid-oriented quests.

simulated_ratings.title: Color Purple, The (1985)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A powerful, enduring story of survival and sisterhood that hit me hard.

simulated_ratings.title: Prince of Egypt, The (1998)
simulated_ratings.feeling: An animated epic with grandeur and heart that nearly matches my favorites.

simulated_ratings.title: Hidden Figures (2016)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Inspiring, well-acted history that celebrates talent and perseverance.

simulated_ratings.title: Knight's Tale, A (2001)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Breezy and likable, though its anachronistic swagger only took me so far.

simulated_ratings.title: Hamilton (2020)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Insightful roundtable that deepened my appreciation, if not as transporting as a performance.

simulated_ratings.title: The Pirate Fairy (2014)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Cute and harmless, but too lightweight for my tastes.

simulated_ratings.title: Legends of the Fall (1994)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Brooding, romantic Americana with the sweep I enjoy.

simulated_ratings.title: Seven Years in Tibet (1997)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A reflective cross-cultural journey that fit my appetite for transformation tales.

simulated_ratings.title: Pluto's Christmas Tree (1952)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Pleasant holiday shtick that made me smile without lingering.

simulated_ratings.title: Oscar (1991)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Broad farce with some charm, ultimately middling for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Visitors, The (Visiteurs, Les) (1993)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Goofy time-travel hijinks that amused more than annoyed.

simulated_ratings.title: Apollo 13 (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Tense, hands-on historical problem-solving that I found gripping.

simulated_ratings.title: Hunt for Red October, The (1990)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A smart, atmospheric thriller that satisfies without bombast.

simulated_ratings.title: Great Race, The (1965)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Grand, old-fashioned slapstick whose charm outweighs its bloat.

simulated_ratings.title: Most Dangerous Man in America: Daniel Ellsberg and the Pentagon Papers, The (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A compelling portrait of conscience and courage that aligns with my historical interests.

simulated_ratings.feeling: Moody and unsettling with a Catholic-gothic edge that kept me engaged.

simulated_ratings.title: Лягушка-путешественница (1965)

simulated_ratings.title: Carnival of Souls (1962)

simulated_ratings.title: Pollyanna (2003)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Earnest sunshine with enough heart to offset the sugar.

simulated_ratings.title: Halloween (1978)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Clean, effective suspense I respect more than love.

simulated_ratings.title: Stunt Man, The (1980)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A witty, paranoid dance between illusion and romance that mostly delighted me.

simulated_ratings.title: Three from Prostokvashino (1978)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Light, homespun charm with friendly faces—nice if not essential for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Good Morning (Ohayô) (1959)

simulated_ratings.title: Portrait of a Lady on Fire (2019)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A luminous, intimate period romance with the artistic and emotional fire I crave.

simulated_ratings.title: Band of Brothers (2001)

simulated_ratings.title: Oskars Kleid (2022)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A compassionate family story about acceptance that felt timely and sincere.

simulated_ratings.title: Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part 1, The (2011)
simulated_ratings.feeling: The honeymoon-to-crisis swing had some sweep, but the operatic angst left me cold.

simulated_ratings.title: Twilight Saga: New Moon, The (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: The heartbreak and risk-taking hooked me in spots, but the teen myth-making wore thin.

simulated_ratings.title: Twilight Saga: Eclipse, The (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: The love-triangle tensions and looming conflict felt busy yet emotionally shallow for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Twilight (2008)
simulated_ratings.feeling: The misty, moody romance intrigued me a bit, even if the teen-vampire intensity kept me at arm’s length.

simulated_ratings.title: Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part 2, The (2012)
simulated_ratings.feeling: The clan-gathering spectacle upped the scale, but the glossy fantasy never found the depth I crave.

simulated_ratings.title: Order, The (2003)
simulated_ratings.feeling: I like spiritual mysteries, but this holy-thriller mix felt more contrived than contemplative.

simulated_ratings.title: Return to Oz (1985)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Its darker, odder Oz had a melancholic charm that worked better on me than most kid quests.

simulated_ratings.title: Blair Witch (2016)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Jitters and woods dread are there, but the increased noise blunts the lingering chill I prefer.

simulated_ratings.title: Ernest Goes to Camp (1987)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Good-natured goofiness with a heart, though the broad shtick wore out its welcome.

simulated_ratings.title: Bridges of Madison County, The (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: An intimate, aching romance that slowly deepened into something tender and true for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Conquest of the Planet of the Apes (1972)
simulated_ratings.feeling: The uprising tale and social undercurrent engaged me, even if the execution shows its seams.

simulated_ratings.title: Holding the Man (2015)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A compassionate, clear-eyed love story whose endurance and losses moved me.

simulated_ratings.title: Nativity Story, The (2006)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Respectful and handsomely mounted, stirring more quiet reverence than revelation for me.

simulated_ratings.title: All the Pretty Horses (2000)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Handsomeness and longing are there, but the sweep and punch I wanted never fully arrived.

simulated_ratings.title: Shampoo (1975)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A breezy, bittersweet pinball through sex and politics that amused while glancing at deeper currents.

simulated_ratings.title: Home Alone 3 (1997)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Harmless hijinks that felt thinner and more mechanical than charming.

simulated_ratings.title: Passion of the Christ, The (2004)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Visceral devotion that I respected, though the graphic focus kept me at a remove.

simulated_ratings.title: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Loud, busy spectacle with little to hold onto beyond empty clatter for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Yu-Gi-Oh! (2004)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Lore-heavy, tie-in fantasy action that never rose above diverting for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Mortal Instruments: City of Bones, The (2013)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A YA swirl of demons and destiny that felt generic despite the mythic trappings.

simulated_ratings.title: Pulse (2006)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A bleak tech-haunt premise I liked in theory, dulled by flat, jumpy execution.

simulated_ratings.title: Blues Brothers 2000 (1998)
simulated_ratings.feeling: The musical goodwill flickers, but the retread plotting left me mostly unmoved.

simulated_ratings.title: Herbie Goes to Monte Carlo (1977)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Light, zippy caper fun with mild charm that faded fast for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Horton Hears a Who! (2008)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Colorful, kindhearted whimsy with enough warmth and wit to win me over.

simulated_ratings.title: After Earth (2013)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A solemn survival trek whose earnestness couldn’t overcome its thinness for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Chronicles of Narnia: Prince Caspian, The (2008)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Mythic adventure with heart that I enjoyed in moments without being swept away.

simulated_ratings.title: Dennis the Menace Christmas, A (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Well-meaning holiday antics that felt cheap and weary more than festive.

simulated_ratings.title: Jack the Giant Slayer (2013)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A serviceable fairy-tale romp whose CG bombast outpaced its sense of wonder.
